original_content:
At the heart of all computers is a clock, a dedicated timepiece ensuring that all of the parts of the computer are synchronized and can work together to execute the instructions that the computer receives. Clock speeds for most modern off-the-shelf computers and smartphones operate around a billion cycles per second, and even clocks that tick at a human-dizzying speed of a million times per second have been around since at least the 1970s. But theres no reason a computer cant run at a much slower speed, as [Greg] demonstrates in this video where he slows down a 6502 processor to a single clock cycle per second.
To reduce the clock speed from the megahertz range down to a single hertz or single clock cycle per second, [Greg] is using the pendulum from an actual clock. He attaches a small magnet to the bottom of the pendulum which is counted by a sensor as it swings past. Feeding that pulse into a monostable conditioner yields a clock signal which is usable for one of his 6502-based computers, and at this extremely slow rate, its possible to see the operation of a lot of the computers inner workings a step at a time. In fact, he optimized the computers operation as this slow speed let him see some inefficiencies in the program he was running.
It helps if your processor is static, of course. Older CPUs with dynamic storage for registers and some with limited-range PLLs would not work with this technique. The 8080A, for example, required a clock of at least 500 kHz.
Not only can this computer use a pendulum clock as the basis for its internal clock, but [Greg] also rigged up a mechanism to use a heartbeat. Getting in a little bit of exercise to increase his heart rate first will noticeably increase the computers speed. And, if youre looking to get a deeper glimpse into the inner workings of a computer, wed recommend looking at one which forgoes transistors in favor of relays.
title: １秒間に１回だけクロックが進む！6502プロセッサを低速化する方法
body: コンピューターの動作を1秒に1回の信号で動かすために、振り子時計の振り子を利用した実験をする動画が公開された。特に古いCPUに有効で、動的なレジスタのあるプロセッサはこの方法では動かせない。また、運動や心拍数によってコンピューターの速度が変化することも示唆された。
titles: １秒間に１回だけクロックが進む！6502プロセッサを低速化する方法
実用的に使用可能な低速クロック信号を実現！振り子クロックで動くコンピュータ
プログラムの非効率性を見つけるための低速クロックでの動作
心拍数を利用した内部クロック！自分の心拍でコンピュータのスピードを変える！
トランジスタではなくリレーを使用したコンピュータの内部構造に迫る！
